citation.article-title: Dysgonomonas mossii sp. nov., from human sources

p.s: Description of Dysgonomonas mossii sp. nov.
Dysgonomonas mossii (N. L. gen. n. mossii, of Moss, to honour Claude Wayne Moss, a contemporary American microbiologist, in recognition of his contributions to microbial taxonomy)
Cells consist of non-motile, Gram-negative coccobacilli to short rods.
After 48 hours of incubation anaerobically at 37 °C on blood agar, colonies are 1–2 mm in diameter, non-adherent, entire, grey-white, smooth and non-haemolytic, and produce a slightly aromatic odour.
Growth occurs at 25°C, but not at 42°C.
Growth does not occur on MacConkey agar.
The organism grows on nutrient agar around X and XV discs, suggesting a growth factor dependency for haem.
Catalaseand oxidase-negative.
Nitrate is not reduced to nitrate.
Indole is produced but acetoin is not.
Resistant to Ox bile.
Aesculin and starch are hydrolysed but gelatin and urea are not.
Glucose is fermented with production of acid but no gas.

Using traditional methods acid is produced from L-arabinose, cellobiose, fructose, inositol (weak reaction), lactose, mannitol (weak reaction), maltose, L-rhamnose (weak reaction), salicin, sucrose, trehalose and D-xylose.
Employing the API rapid ID 32A system acid is produced from mannose but D-raffinose may or may not be fermented.

Positive reactions are obtained for N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, alanine arylamidase, alkaline phosphatase, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-galactosidase 6-phosphate (weak reaction), α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, leucyl glycine arylamidase, α-mannosidase (weak reaction) and α-fucosidase.

Arginine dehydrolase, arginine arylamidase, β-glucuronidase, glutamyl glutamic acid arylamidase, glutamic acid decarboxylase, glycine arylamidase, histidine arylamidase, leucine arylamidase, phenylalanine arylamidase, proline arylamidase, pyroglutamic acid arylamidase, serine arylamidase and tyrosine arylamidase are not detected.
α-Arabinosidase may or may not be produced.
Isolated from human clinical sources.
Habitat is not known.
The type strain is CCUG 43457T (=CIP 107079T).
The G + C content of the type strain is 38.5 mol%.
